content.description: The true hipsters' choice boulder problem. Stand start on the triangle block and begin to work a series of different underclings. Another couple moves lead into the same amazing pinch of 'Cooler Than You', then pull the same heartbreaker finish. Probably a touch easier than Cooler once the beta is unlocked and dialed in. Bottoms up!
content.location: Start at the back center of the cave.

climbs.name: Mr. Beanie
climbs.fa: Luke Ross, Andrew Bellisle, Chris Hirsch, Oct 2019

content.description: Long problem that begins with a large deadpoint from the sit start off a big flake. Then take a hard right following good crimps out to a jug "rest". Sack up for the tall, but not-so-bad top out. Not a bad idea to preview the top out first though.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: Starts on the far left side of the cave on an obvious starting jug. Traverses to the center of the cave to the shared top out. Down climb way to the left.

content.description: This shares the same opening moves with 'Mr. Beanie' then goes straight up the nose into the slightly scary top out. Once the seam is reached after pulling the bulge, the top should hopefully be over, otherwise a fall could be very bad.
A two move wonder. Stand start on the left facing schist flake. Dyno out right then continue traversing on large slopers, topping out on 'Dream of the Nineties'.Â
content.protection: Several pads. Landing is a rock slab that slopes away.

climbs.name: Dream of the Nineties
climbs.fa: Chris Hirsch, Eric Hansen, Luke Kretschmar, Aaron Stetzer, Logan Grosz, Nov 2020

content.description: The warm up for the cave. Starts sitting down, left hand in a slot, right hand in a lower slot. Wall on the right side is off. Straightforward movement with a couple of long pulls on good rock. Long, but easy, top out up and left. The dream of the nineties is alive in the hipster cave.
content.protection: Pads. Sloped landing, spotters are nice.

content.description: Sit start on the obvious rail. Move through multiple crimps, get loaded up, and throw to the ledge. Top out up and right.
content.location: This lies on the far left side, just outside the cave proper.

content.description: Power endurance, gym-like holds, kneebars...this may as well be Hueco Tanks! Crouch start with hands on two adjacent crimps. Flow through the middle moves then figure out some fancy beta before the heartbreaker move to gain the jugs. Keep it together for the tall top out.
content.protection: Several pads and spotters, landing is good.
content.location: Center line that climbs directly to the top out notch that all the problems share.

content.description: This cave is somewhat of a godsend for hard bouldering in the Hills. It's not often we get such steep features paired with high quality rock. Positioned above, and behind the waterfall, atop rock slabs makes for a great setting. SW facing but too steep for the sun to hit the rock. Can seep in a few spots after a recent rain or snow. Given the cave's exposed location and tall top outs, spotters are needed to avoid potentially tumbling another 30-40'. Aside from that, the landing zone is fairly large and flat.
